title: Venetian Merchants and Global Trade
description: A fast breakdown of Venetian Merchants and Global Trade for builders.

hook.text: Marco Polo brought tales of Eastern wealth back to Venice. Merchants raced to find his trade routes.

buildup.text: Venice grew into Europe's richest city by controlling trade between East and West for centuries.

discovery.text: Venetian merchants invented double-entry bookkeeping, trade insurance, and the joint-stock company.

twist.text: Their empire ended when Portugal found a sea route to India, bypassing Venice entirely.

climax.text: Venice proved that whoever controls distribution channels controls the market â€” then and now.

punchline.text: Control the route and you control the trade.
